content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"           xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/"           xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">    <dc:title>Highly Migratory Species Fishing Permits</dc:title>    <dcterms:alternative>Highly Migratory Species Fishing Permits</dcterms:alternative>    <dc:language xsi:type="dcterms:ISO639-3">eng</dc:language>    <dc:type xsi:type="dcterms:DCMIType">Dataset</dc:type>    <dc:subject>Highly Migratory Species, stock assessment, fishing permit, shark, tuna</dc:subject>    <dcterms:abstract>The Highly Migratory Species Management (HMS) Division issues a variety of fishing permits that allow commercial and recreational fishing using many different gear types and fishing practices.  The HMS Division issues permits to dealers for swordfish, tunas, and shark.  The HMS Division also authorizes scientific study and aquarium collection through an exempted fishing permit program.  The HMS Division also requires any fishing tournaments that target highly migratory species to register and report the catch if selected. </dcterms:abstract>    <dc:publisher>NMFS Office Of Sustainable Fisheries</dc:publisher>    <dc:creator>NMFS Office Of Sustainable Fisheries</dc:creator>    <dc:identifier xsi:type="dcterms:URI">                 https://inport.nmfs.noaa.gov/inport/item/3416</dc:identifier>    <dcterms:isPartOf xsi:type="dcterms:URI">                 https://inport.nmfs.noaa.gov/inport/item/3415</dcterms:isPartOf>    <dcterms:spatial>                         name=Northwest Atlantic Ocean, Gulf of Mexico, Caribbean Sea;                     </dcterms:spatial> </metadata>
